name: Document Type
desc: Instruction to the web browser about what version of the markup language the page is written in. It  should be the very first thing in an HTML document, before the <html> tag.

name: HTML
desc: The root element. It tells the browser that this is an HTML document. It is the outermost element in HTML and XHTML documents

name: Head
desc: A container for all the head elements. Elements inside can include scripts, instruct the browser where to find style sheets, provide meta information, and more. The <title> tag is the only required element in the head section.

name: Title
desc: Defines the title of the document.

name: Body
desc: Defines the document's body. Contains all the contents of an HTML document, such as text, hyperlinks, images, tables, lists, etc.

name: Comment
desc: Used to insert a comment in the source code. Will be ignored by the browser.

name: Base
desc: Specifies a default address or a default target for all links on a page.

name: Blockquote
example:
\n

Here is a long quotation, here is a long quotation

\n

name: Address
desc: Defines the contact information for the author or owner of a document. This way, the reader is able to contact the document's owner.
example:
Written by John Smith
Email me
Address: Box 123, Myzone
Phone: +12 34 56 78

name: Abbreviation
desc: Describes an abbreviated phrase.\nBy marking up abbreviations you can give useful information to browsers, spellcheckers, screen readers, translation systems and search-engines using attribute title.

name: Acronym
desc: Describes an acronym.\nBy marking up acronyms you can give useful information to browsers, spellcheckers, screen readers, translation systems and search-engines using attribute title.

name: Bi-directional Override
desc: Allows to specify the text direction and override the bidirectional algorithm.

name: Anchor
desc: Defines an anchor. Can be used in two ways:\na) To create a link to another document, by using the href attribute.\nb) To create a bookmark inside a document, by using the id attribute.

name: Image
desc: Embeds an image in an HTML page.\nRequires attributes src & alt.

name: Area
desc: Defines an area inside an image-map (an image-map is an image with clickable areas). The area element is always nested inside a <map> tag. Requires attribute alt.
